Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Mollie Siegel Collection on Anti-Nuclear and Peace Movement Activism
Siegel, Mollie
Halpern, Annette
TAM.794
.5 linear feet in 1 manuscript box
1957-1999 Mollie Siegel (1918-2011) was a California activist and nurse involved in the Nuclear Freeze campaign, anti-war movements, and other progressive social movements in the mid- and late 20th century. The Mollie Siegel Collection on Anti-Nuclear and Peace Movement Activism (dated 1957-1999) consists of materials created and collected by Siegel documenting her organizing work in the peace and anti-nuclear movements in California. The bulk of the collection consists of pamphlets, flyers for actions, newsletters, reading lists, and reports, many of which had been initially laid into a scrapbook. The collection also contains handwritten notes, copies of letters Siegel received from elected representatives, and a copy of the cookbook Peace De Resistance. Major topics present in this collection include the American military budget, the Nuclear Freeze campaign, international arms agreements, and peace activism, with particular emphasis on opposition to American involvement in the Vietnam War and the Gulf War. The activities of South Bay Citizens for Peace are particularly well represented. In addition to the specific movements documented in this collection, these materials also reflect the activism of this period through Siegel's perspective as a woman. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Annette Halpern in December 2020; the accession number associated with this gift is 2020.045.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Mollie Siegel Collection on Anti-Nuclear and Peace Movement Activism; TAM 794; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in an archival box and folders in their existing order. Materials were described on the collection-level with a folder-list.
Appraisal
Some of the ephemera in this collection had been initially laid into a scrapbook. The exterior of the original scrapbook was not included in this collection due to its physical condition and the lack of contextual information it provided.
Biographical Note
Mollie Siegel (1918-2011) was a California activist and nurse involved in the Nuclear Freeze campaign, anti-war movements, and other progressive social movements in the mid- and late 20th century. She was particularly active with Women's Strike for Peace, SANE-Nuclear Freeze, and the Nation Associates.
